channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stock Futures Fall With Nasdaq-100 Leading Declines
item.description: Stock Futures linked to major U.S. markets fell, with contracts tied to the tech-heavy Nasdaq-100 down more than 1%.

item.title: The Fed’s rate cuts were supposed to make borrowing cheaper. So why is it harder than ever to buy a house?
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cuts have done little to help home buyers and sellers.

item.title: The stock market offers slim pickings — but here are some bargain-shopping ideas
item.description: Bearish signs appear on Wall Street, and it’s time to exit long bond positions.

item.title: The Fed cut rates again — but don’t expect your credit-card APR to get much lower anytime soon. Here’s why.
item.description: Interest-rate cuts are supposed to lower borrowing costs, but that’s not necessarily happening for credit-card users.

item.title: Bitcoin Went Mainstream in 2024. Are Ether, Solana and Other Risky Tokens Next?
item.description: Asset managers hoping to seize on the momentum of bitcoin funds are jockeying to put smaller tokens into exchange-traded funds.

item.title: How American Health Insurance Got So Infuriating
item.description: The UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting has sharpened the public’s focus on the role of private insurers, a necessary evil in the U.S. healthcare system.

item.title: The Fed Cut Rates. Mortgage Costs Went Up.
item.description: Surging Treasury yields have pushed borrowing costs higher.

item.title: Trump says EU will face tariffs unless it buys more U.S. oil and gas
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump called on the EU to reduce its trade deficit by buying more American oil and gas

item.title: Base Metals Edge Higher But Weakness Persists
item.description: Base metals recovered some ground, but remained largely subdued after the Fed’s hawkish shift led the dollar to rally, however Sucden Financial expect...

item.title: ‘I keep hearing about break-ins in my neighborhood’: Are banks responsible for items kept in a safe-deposit box? Are there other options?
item.description: “I read that the bank discourages people from storing jewelry and coins in the boxes, so I did not rent one.”
